title.raw: 《陳杞世家》 Houses of Chen and Qi

sentences.zh: 陳胡公滿者，虞帝舜之後也。

translations.literal: Chen Hu Gong Man was Yu Emperor Shun's descendant.
translations.idiomatic: Chen's Duke Hu Man was a descendant of Emperor Shun of Yu.

sentences.zh: 昔舜為庶人時，堯妻之二女，居于媯汭，其後因為氏姓，姓媯氏。

translations.literal: Formerly when Shun was a commoner, Yao married him two daughters, and they resided at Gui Rui. Their descendants therefore became the clan surname, the Gui clan.

sentences.zh: 舜已崩，傳禹天下，而舜子商均為封國。

translations.literal: Shun had already passed away and transmitted the world to Yu, while Shun's son Shang Jun was made an enfeoffed state.

sentences.zh: 夏后之時，或失或續。

translations.literal: During the Xia Hou time, some were lost and some continued.

sentences.zh: 至于周武王克殷紂，乃復求舜後，得媯滿，封之於陳，以奉帝舜祀，是為胡公。

translations.literal: When Zhou's King Wu conquered Yin Zhou, he then again sought Shun's descendants, obtained Gui Man, and enfeoffed him at Chen to continue Emperor Shun's sacrifices. This was Duke Hu.

sentences.zh: 胡公卒，子申公犀侯立。

translations.literal: Duke Hu died, and his son Duke Shen Xi Hou ascended.

sentences.zh: 申公卒，弟相公皋羊立。

translations.literal: Duke Shen died, and his younger brother Duke Xiang Gao Yang ascended.

sentences.zh: 相公卒，立申公子突，是為孝公。

translations.literal: Duke Xiang died, and they established Duke Shen's son Tu, who became Duke Xiao.

sentences.zh: 孝公卒，子慎公圉戎立。

translations.literal: Duke Xiao died, and his son Duke Shen Yu Rong ascended.

sentences.zh: 慎公當周厲王時。

translations.literal: Duke Shen was during King Li of Zhou's time.

sentences.zh: 慎公卒，子幽公寧立。

translations.literal: Duke Shen died, and his son Duke You Ning ascended.

sentences.zh: 幽公十二年，周厲王奔于彘。

translations.literal: In Duke You's twelfth year, King Li of Zhou fled to Zhi.

sentences.zh: 二十三年，幽公卒，子釐公孝立。

translations.literal: In the twenty-third year, Duke You died, and his son Duke Xi Xiao ascended.

sentences.zh: 釐公六年，周宣王即位。

translations.literal: In Duke Xi's sixth year, King Xuan of Zhou ascended the throne.

sentences.zh: 三十六年，釐公卒，子武公靈立。

translations.literal: In the thirty-sixth year, Duke Xi died, and his son Duke Wu Ling ascended.

sentences.zh: 武公十五年卒，子夷公說立。

translations.literal: Duke Wu died in his fifteenth year, and his son Duke Yi Yue ascended.

sentences.zh: 是歲，周幽王即位。

translations.literal: In this year, King You of Zhou ascended the throne.

sentences.zh: 夷公三年卒，弟平公燮立。

translations.literal: Duke Yi died in his third year, and his younger brother Duke Ping Xie ascended.

sentences.zh: 平公七年，周幽王為犬戎所殺，周東徙。

translations.literal: In Duke Ping's seventh year, King You of Zhou was killed by the Quan Rong, and Zhou moved east.

sentences.zh: 秦始列為諸侯。

translations.literal: Qin began to be ranked as feudal lords.

sentences.zh: 二十三年，平公卒，子文公圉立。

translations.literal: In the twenty-third year, Duke Ping died, and his son Duke Wen Yu ascended.

sentences.zh: 文公元年，取蔡女，生子佗。

translations.literal: In Duke Wen's first year, he took a Cai woman and gave birth to a son named Tuo.

sentences.zh: 十年，文公卒，長子桓公鮑立。

translations.literal: In the tenth year, Duke Wen died, and his eldest son Duke Huan Bao ascended.

sentences.zh: 桓公二十三年，魯隱公初立。

translations.literal: In Duke Huan's twenty-third year, Duke Yin of Lu first ascended.

sentences.zh: 二十六年，衛殺其君州吁。

translations.literal: In the twenty-sixth year, Wei assassinated their lord Zhou Xu.

sentences.zh: 三十三年，魯弒其君隱公。

translations.literal: In the thirty-third year, Lu assassinated their lord Duke Yin.

sentences.zh: 三十八年正月甲戌己丑，桓公鮑卒。

translations.literal: In the thirty-eighth year, first month, Jia Xu Ji Chou, Duke Huan Bao died.

sentences.zh: 桓公弟佗，其母蔡女，故蔡人為佗殺五父及桓公太子免而立佗，是為厲公。

translations.literal: Duke Huan's younger brother Tuo—his mother was a Cai woman, so the Cai people killed Wu Fu and Duke Huan's crown prince Mian on Tuo's behalf and established Tuo, who became Duke Li.

sentences.zh: 桓公病而亂作，國人分散，故再赴。

translations.literal: Duke Huan was ill and chaos arose. The state people dispersed, so there was a double announcement.

sentences.zh: 厲公二年，生子敬仲完。

translations.literal: In Duke Li's second year, he gave birth to a son named Jing Zhong Wan.

sentences.zh: 周太史過陳，陳厲公使以《周易》筮之，卦得觀之否：「是為觀國之光，利用賓于王。

translations.literal: Zhou Grand Scribe passed Chen, Chen Li Gong made with Zhou Yi divine it, hexagram obtained Guan of Pi: 'This is observe state light, beneficial guest at wang.
translations.idiomatic: The Zhou Grand Scribe passed through Chen. Duke Li of Chen had him divine with the Zhou Yi, and the hexagram obtained Guan over Pi: 'This is to observe the state's light, beneficial to be a guest of the wang.

sentences.zh: 此其代陳有國乎？

translations.literal: This will replace Chen have state?
translations.idiomatic: Will this replace Chen and have a state?

sentences.zh: 不在此，其在異國？

translations.literal: Not here, perhaps in different country?
translations.idiomatic: Not here, perhaps in a different country?

sentences.zh: 非此其身，在其子孫。

translations.literal: Not this person himself, but in his descendants.

sentences.zh: 若在異國，必姜姓。

translations.literal: If in a different country, it must be the Jiang surname.

sentences.zh: 姜姓，太嶽之後。

translations.literal: The Jiang surname are descendants of Tai Yue.

sentences.zh: 物莫能兩大，陳衰，此其昌乎？」

translations.literal: Things cannot two great, Chen declines, this will prosper?'
translations.idiomatic: Things cannot have two that are great. Chen declines, so this will prosper?'

sentences.zh: 厲公取蔡女，蔡女與蔡人亂，厲公數如蔡淫。

translations.literal: Duke Li took a Cai woman, but the Cai woman had illicit relations with Cai people. Duke Li frequently went to Cai to be licentious.

sentences.zh: 七年，厲公所殺桓公太子免之三弟，長曰躍，中曰林，少曰杵臼，共令蔡人誘厲公以好女，與蔡人共殺厲公而立躍，是為利公。

translations.literal: In the seventh year, the three younger brothers of the Huan Gong crown prince Mian whom Li Gong had killed—the eldest named Yue, the middle named Lin, the youngest named Chu Jiu—together commanded the Cai people to lure Duke Li with beautiful women, and together with the Cai people killed Duke Li and established Yue, who became Duke Li.

sentences.zh: 利公者，桓公子也。

translations.literal: Duke Li was Duke Huan's son.

sentences.zh: 利公立五月卒，立中弟林，是為莊公。

translations.literal: Duke Li ascended for five months and died. They established his middle younger brother Lin, who became Duke Zhuang.

sentences.zh: 莊公七年卒，少弟杵臼立，是為宣公。

translations.literal: Duke Zhuang died in his seventh year. His youngest younger brother Chu Jiu ascended, who became Duke Xuan.

sentences.zh: 宣公三年，楚武王卒，楚始彊。

translations.literal: In Duke Xuan's third year, King Wu of Chu died, and Chu began to grow strong.

sentences.zh: 十七年，周惠王娶陳女為后。

translations.literal: In the seventeenth year, King Hui of Zhou married a Chen woman as his queen.

sentences.zh: 二十一年，宣公後有嬖姬生子款，欲立之，乃殺其太子御寇。

translations.literal: In the twenty-first year, Duke Xuan's queen had a favored concubine who gave birth to a son named Kuan. He desired to establish him, so he killed his crown prince Yu Kou.

sentences.zh: 御寇素愛厲公子完，完懼禍及己，乃奔齊。

translations.literal: Yu Kou usually loved Duke Li's son Wan. Wan feared calamity would reach himself, so he fled to Qi.

sentences.zh: 齊桓公欲使陳完為卿，完曰：「羈旅之臣，幸得免負檐，君之惠也，不敢當高位。」

translations.literal: Qi Huan Gong desired make Chen Wan minister, Wan said: 'Sojourning minister, fortunately obtained avoid carrying eaves, lord's favor, dare not accept high position.'
translations.idiomatic: Duke Huan of Qi desired to make Chen Wan a minister. Wan said: 'A sojourning minister, I have fortunately obtained to avoid carrying eaves. It is your lordship's favor. I dare not accept a high position.'

sentences.zh: 桓公使為工正。

translations.literal: Duke Huan made him Gong Zheng.

sentences.zh: 齊懿仲欲妻陳敬仲，卜之，占曰：「是謂鳳皇于飛，和鳴鏘鏘。

translations.literal: Qi Yi Zhong desired marry Chen Jing Zhong, divined it, omen said: 'This called phoenix in flight, harmonious cry clang clang.
translations.idiomatic: Qi Yi Zhong desired to marry Chen Jing Zhong. He divined it, and the omen said: 'This is called phoenix in flight, harmonious cry clang clang.

sentences.zh: 有媯之後，將育于姜。

translations.literal: Have Gui descendants, will be nourished at Jiang.

sentences.zh: 五世其昌，并于正卿。

translations.literal: Five generations will prosper, equal to the proper ministers.

sentences.zh: 八世之後，莫之與京。」

translations.literal: Eight generations after, none rival with Jing.'
translations.idiomatic: Eight generations later, none will rival with Jing.'

sentences.zh: 三十七年，齊桓公伐蔡，蔡敗；

translations.literal: Thirty-seventh year, Qi Huan Gong attacked Cai, Cai defeated;
translations.idiomatic: In the thirty-seventh year, Duke Huan of Qi attacked Cai, and Cai was defeated;

sentences.zh: 南侵楚，至召陵，還過陳。

translations.literal: He invaded south to Chu, reached Zhao Ling, and on his return passed through Chen.

sentences.zh: 陳大夫轅濤涂惡其過陳，詐齊令出東道。

translations.literal: Chen's grand officer Yuan Tao Tu disliked his passing through Chen and deceived Qi by commanding him to take the east road.

sentences.zh: 東道惡，桓公怒，執陳轅濤涂。

translations.literal: The east road was bad. Duke Huan was angered and seized Chen's Yuan Tao Tu.

sentences.zh: 是歲，晉獻公殺其太子申生。

translations.literal: In this year, Duke Xian of Jin killed his crown prince Shen Sheng.

sentences.zh: 四十五年，宣公卒，子款立，是為穆公。

translations.literal: In the forty-fifth year, Duke Xuan died, and his son Kuan ascended, who became Duke Mu.

sentences.zh: 穆公五年，齊桓公卒。

translations.literal: In Duke Mu's fifth year, Duke Huan of Qi died.

sentences.zh: 十六年，晉文公敗楚師于城濮。

translations.literal: In the sixteenth year, Duke Wen of Jin defeated Chu troops at Cheng Pu.

sentences.zh: 是歲，穆公卒，子共公朔立。

translations.literal: In this year, Duke Mu died, and his son Duke Gong Shuo ascended.

sentences.zh: 共公六年，楚太子商臣弒其父成王代立，是為穆王。

translations.literal: In Duke Gong's sixth year, Chu's Crown Prince Shang Chen assassinated his father King Cheng and replaced him, becoming King Mu.

sentences.zh: 十一年，秦穆公卒。

translations.literal: In the eleventh year, Duke Mu of Qin died.

sentences.zh: 十八年，共公卒，子靈公平國立。

translations.literal: In the eighteenth year, Duke Gong died, and his son Duke Ling Ping Guo ascended.

sentences.zh: 靈公元年，楚莊王即位。

translations.literal: In Duke Ling's first year, King Zhuang of Chu ascended the throne.

sentences.zh: 六年，楚伐陳。

translations.literal: In the sixth year, Chu attacked Chen.

sentences.zh: 十年，陳及楚平。

translations.literal: In the tenth year, Chen and Chu made peace.

sentences.zh: 十四年，靈公與其大夫孔寧、儀行父皆通於夏姬，衷其衣以戲於朝。

translations.literal: In the fourteenth year, Duke Ling and his grand officers Kong Ning and Yi Xing Fu all had relations with Xia Ji. They wore her undergarments to play in court.

sentences.zh: 泄冶諫曰：「君臣淫亂，民何效焉？」

translations.literal: Xie Ye admonished said: 'Lord minister licentious chaos, people what imitate?'
translations.idiomatic: Xie Ye admonished, saying: 'Lord and ministers in licentious chaos—what should the people imitate?'

sentences.zh: 靈公以告二子，二子請殺泄冶，公弗禁，遂殺泄冶。

translations.literal: Duke Ling told his two sons. The two sons requested to kill Xie Ye. The duke did not forbid it, so they killed Xie Ye.

sentences.zh: 十五年，靈公與二子飲於夏氏。

translations.literal: In the fifteenth year, Duke Ling drank with his two sons at the Xia clan.

sentences.zh: 公戲二子曰：「徵舒似汝。」

translations.literal: Gong teased two sons said: 'Xia Zheng Shu resembles you.'
translations.idiomatic: The duke teased his two sons, saying: 'Xia Zheng Shu resembles you.'

sentences.zh: 二子曰：「亦似公。」

translations.literal: Two sons said: 'Also resembles gong.'
translations.idiomatic: The two sons said: 'He also resembles you, father.'

sentences.zh: 徵舒怒。

translations.literal: Xia Zheng Shu was angered.

sentences.zh: 靈公罷酒出，徵舒伏弩廏門射殺靈公。

translations.literal: Duke Ling stopped drinking and went out. Xia Zheng Shu hid a crossbow at the stable gate and shot Duke Ling to death.

sentences.zh: 孔寧、儀行父皆奔楚，靈公太子午奔晉。

translations.literal: Kong Ning and Yi Xing Fu all fled to Chu. Duke Ling's crown prince Wu fled to Jin.

sentences.zh: 徵舒自立為陳侯。

translations.literal: Xia Zheng Shu established himself as Duke of Chen.

sentences.zh: 徵舒，故陳大夫也。

translations.literal: Xia Zheng Shu was formerly a grand officer of Chen.

sentences.zh: 夏姬，御叔之妻，舒之母也。

translations.literal: Xia Ji, Yu Shu's wife, Shu's mother.
translations.idiomatic: Xia Ji was Yu Shu's wife and Shu's mother.

sentences.zh: 成公元年冬，楚莊王為夏徵舒殺靈公，率諸侯伐陳。

translations.literal: In Duke Cheng's first year winter, King Zhuang of Chu, because Xia Zheng Shu killed Duke Ling, led the feudal lords to attack Chen.

sentences.zh: 謂陳曰：「無驚，吾誅徵舒而已。」

translations.literal: Told Chen said: 'Do not fear, I execute Xia Zheng Shu only.'
translations.idiomatic: He told Chen, saying: 'Do not fear. I am only executing Xia Zheng Shu.'

sentences.zh: 已誅徵舒，因縣陳而有之，群臣畢賀。

translations.literal: Having executed Xia Zheng Shu, he therefore suspended Chen and possessed it. All the ministers congratulated him.

sentences.zh: 申叔時使於齊來還，獨不賀。

translations.literal: Shen Shu Shi, who was envoy to Qi, came back and alone did not congratulate.

sentences.zh: 莊王問其故，對曰：「鄙語有之，牽牛徑人田，田主奪之牛。

translations.literal: Zhuang Wang asked its reason, replied said: 'Vulgar saying has it, leading ox trespasses person's field, field owner seizes the ox.
translations.idiomatic: King Zhuang asked the reason. He replied, saying: 'Vulgar sayings have it: leading an ox trespasses on a person's field, the field owner seizes the ox.

sentences.zh: 徑則有罪矣，奪之牛，不亦甚乎？

translations.literal: Trespassing then has guilt, seizing the ox, not also excessive?
translations.idiomatic: Trespassing then has guilt. Seizing the ox—isn't that also excessive?

sentences.zh: 今王以徵舒為賊弒君，故徵兵諸侯，以義伐之，已而取之，以利其地，則後何以令於天下！

translations.literal: Now wang with Xia Zheng Shu as traitor assassinated lord, therefore summoned troops feudal lords, with righteousness attacked it, already then took it, to profit its land, then later how command world!
translations.idiomatic: Now your majesty regards Xia Zheng Shu as a traitor who assassinated his lord, therefore summons troops from the feudal lords, attacks it with righteousness, then takes it, to profit from its land—then later how can you command the world!

sentences.zh: 是以不賀。」

translations.literal: Therefore did not congratulate.'
translations.idiomatic: Therefore I did not congratulate.'

sentences.zh: 莊王曰：「善。」

translations.literal: Zhuang Wang said: 'Good.'
translations.idiomatic: King Zhuang said: 'Good.'

sentences.zh: 乃迎陳靈公太子午於晉而立之，復君陳如故，是為成公。

translations.literal: He then welcomed Chen's Duke Ling's crown prince Wu from Jin and established him, again ruling Chen as before. This was Duke Cheng.

sentences.zh: 孔子讀史記至楚復陳，曰：「賢哉楚莊王！

translations.literal: Kong Qiu read historical records to Chu restored Chen, said: 'Worthy indeed Chu Zhuang Wang!
translations.idiomatic: Kong Qiu read the historical records to where Chu restored Chen and said: 'Worthy indeed is King Zhuang of Chu!

sentences.zh: 輕千乘之國而重一言。」

translations.literal: Light thousand chariot state but heavy one word.'
translations.idiomatic: He took lightly a state of a thousand chariots but valued one word.'

sentences.zh: ［二十］八年，楚莊王卒。

translations.literal: [Twenty] eighth year, Chu Zhuang Wang died.
translations.idiomatic: In the [twenty] eighth year, King Zhuang of Chu died.

sentences.zh: 二十九年，陳倍楚盟。

translations.literal: In the twenty-ninth year, Chen doubled-crossed the Chu alliance.

sentences.zh: 三十年，楚共王伐陳。

translations.literal: In the thirtieth year, King Gong of Chu attacked Chen.

sentences.zh: 是歲，成公卒，子哀公弱立。

translations.literal: In this year, Duke Cheng died, and his son Duke Ai Ruo ascended.

sentences.zh: 楚以陳喪，罷兵去。

translations.literal: Chu, because of Chen's mourning, stopped the troops and left.

sentences.zh: 哀公三年，楚圍陳，復釋之。

translations.literal: In Duke Ai's third year, Chu surrounded Chen, then freed it again.

sentences.zh: 二十八年，楚公子圍弒其君郟敖自立，為靈王。

translations.literal: In the twenty-eighth year, Chu's Prince Wei assassinated his lord Jia Ao and self-established, becoming King Ling.

sentences.zh: 三十四年，初，哀公娶鄭，長姬生悼太子師，少姬生偃。

translations.literal: In the thirty-fourth year, initially Duke Ai married a woman from Zheng. His elder wife gave birth to Crown Prince Dao Shi, his younger wife gave birth to Yan.

sentences.zh: 二嬖妾，長妾生留，少妾生勝。

translations.literal: Two favored concubines: the elder concubine gave birth to Liu, the younger concubine gave birth to Sheng.

sentences.zh: 留有寵哀公，哀公屬之其弟司徒招。

translations.literal: Liu was favored by Duke Ai. Duke Ai entrusted him to his younger brother Si Tu Zhao.

sentences.zh: 哀公病，三月，招殺悼太子，立留為太子。

translations.literal: Duke Ai was ill. In the third month, Zhao killed the Dao crown prince and established Liu as crown prince.

sentences.zh: 哀公怒，欲誅招，招發兵圍守哀公，哀公自經殺。

translations.literal: Duke Ai was angered and desired to execute Zhao. Zhao raised troops and surrounded Duke Ai. Duke Ai hanged himself.

sentences.zh: 招卒立留為陳君。

translations.literal: Zhao finally established Liu as lord of Chen.

sentences.zh: 四月，陳使使赴楚。

translations.literal: In the fourth month, Chen sent an envoy to Chu.

sentences.zh: 楚靈王聞陳亂，乃殺陳使者，使公子棄疾發兵伐陳，陳君留奔鄭。

translations.literal: King Ling of Chu heard of Chen's chaos and killed the Chen envoy. He had Prince Qi Ji raise troops to attack Chen. Chen's lord Liu fled to Zheng.

sentences.zh: 九月，楚圍陳。

translations.literal: In the ninth month, Chu surrounded Chen.

sentences.zh: 十一月，滅陳。

translations.literal: In the eleventh month, they extinguished Chen.

sentences.zh: 使棄疾為陳公。

translations.literal: They made Qi Ji the Duke of Chen.

sentences.zh: 招之殺悼太子也，太子之子名吳，出奔晉。

translations.literal: Zhao what killed Dao crown prince, crown prince's son named Wu, fled Jin.
translations.idiomatic: When Zhao killed the Dao crown prince, the crown prince's son named Wu fled to Jin.

sentences.zh: 晉平公問太史趙曰：「陳遂亡乎？」

translations.literal: Jin Ping Gong asked grand scribe Zhao said: 'Chen finally perish?'
translations.idiomatic: Duke Ping of Jin asked Grand Scribe Zhao, saying: 'Will Chen finally perish?'

sentences.zh: 對曰：「陳，顓頊之族。

translations.literal: Replied said: 'Chen, Zhuan Xu clan.
translations.idiomatic: He replied, saying: 'Chen is the clan of Zhuan Xu.

sentences.zh: 陳氏得政於齊，乃卒亡。

translations.literal: The Chen clan obtained government in Qi, and then finally perished.

sentences.zh: 自幕至于瞽瞍，無違命。

translations.literal: From Mu until Gu Sou, none violated commands.

sentences.zh: 舜重之以明德。

translations.literal: Shun weighted them with bright virtue.

sentences.zh: 至於遂，世世守之。

translations.literal: They arrived at Sui and guarded it generation after generation.

sentences.zh: 及胡公，周賜之姓，使祀虞帝。

translations.literal: And Duke Hu—Zhou granted him a surname and made him sacrifice to Emperor Yu.

sentences.zh: 且盛德之後，必百世祀。

translations.literal: Moreover, descendants of flourishing virtue must sacrifice for a hundred generations.

sentences.zh: 虞之世未也，其在齊乎？」

translations.literal: Yu world not end, perhaps in Qi?'
translations.idiomatic: Yu's world has not ended—perhaps it is in Qi?'

sentences.zh: 楚靈王滅陳五歲，楚公子棄疾弒靈王代立，是為平王。

translations.literal: Five years after King Ling of Chu extinguished Chen, Chu's Prince Qi Ji assassinated King Ling and replaced him, becoming King Ping.

sentences.zh: 平王初立，欲得和諸侯，乃求故陳悼太子師之子吳，立為陳侯，是為惠公。

translations.literal: Ping Wang first ascended, desired obtain harmony feudal lords, then sought former Chen Dao crown prince Shi's son Wu, established as Chen Hou, this was Hui Gong.
translations.idiomatic: King Ping first ascended and desired to obtain harmony with the feudal lords. He then sought the former Chen Dao crown prince Shi's son Wu and established him as Duke of Chen, who became Duke Hui.

sentences.zh: 惠公立，探續哀公卒時年而為元，空籍五歲矣。

translations.literal: Duke Hui ascended. He investigated and continued from Duke Ai's death year as the yuan year. The register was empty for five years.

sentences.zh: 十年，陳火。

translations.literal: In the tenth year, Chen had a fire.

sentences.zh: 十五年，吳王僚使公子光伐陳，取胡、沈而去。

translations.literal: In the fifteenth year, King Liao of Wu had Prince Guang attack Chen, took Hu and Shen, and left.

sentences.zh: 二十八年，吳王闔閭與子胥敗楚入郢。

translations.literal: In the twenty-eighth year, King He Lu of Wu with Zi Xu defeated Chu and entered Ying.

sentences.zh: 是年，惠公卒，子懷公柳立。

translations.literal: In this year, Duke Hui died, and his son Duke Huai Liu ascended.

sentences.zh: 懷公元年，吳破楚，在郢，召陳侯。

translations.literal: In Duke Huai's first year, Wu broke Chu and was at Ying, summoning the Chen hou.

sentences.zh: 陳侯欲往，大夫曰：「吳新得意；

translations.literal: Chen Hou desired go, grand officers said: 'Wu newly obtained delight;
translations.idiomatic: The Chen hou desired to go. The grand officers said: 'Wu has newly obtained delight;

sentences.zh: 楚王雖亡，與陳有故，不可倍。」

translations.literal: Chu wang though perished, with Chen has old relations, cannot double-cross.'
translations.idiomatic: Though the Chu wang has perished, Chen has old relations with Chu, cannot double-cross.'

sentences.zh: 懷公乃以疾謝吳。

translations.literal: Duke Huai then declined Wu with illness.

sentences.zh: 四年，吳復召懷公。

translations.literal: In the fourth year, Wu again summoned Duke Huai.

sentences.zh: 懷公恐，如吳。

translations.literal: Duke Huai feared and went to Wu.

sentences.zh: 吳怒其前不往，留之，因卒吳。

translations.literal: Wu was angered by his previous not going and detained him. He therefore died in Wu.

sentences.zh: 陳乃立懷公之子越，是為湣公。

translations.literal: Chen then established Huai Gong's son Yue, this was Min Gong.
translations.idiomatic: Chen then established Duke Huai's son Yue, who became Duke Min.

sentences.zh: 湣公六年，孔子適陳。

translations.literal: In Duke Min's sixth year, Kong Qiu went to Chen.

sentences.zh: 吳王夫差伐陳，取三邑而去。

translations.literal: King Fu Cha of Wu attacked Chen, took three cities, and left.

sentences.zh: 十三年，吳復來伐陳，陳告急楚，楚昭王來救，軍於城父，吳師去。

translations.literal: In the thirteenth year, Wu again came to attack Chen. Chen reported urgently to Chu. King Zhao of Chu came to save them and stationed at Cheng Fu. The Wu troops left.

sentences.zh: 是年，楚昭王卒於城父。

translations.literal: In this year, King Zhao of Chu died at Cheng Fu.

sentences.zh: 時孔子在陳。

translations.literal: At that time, Kong Qiu was in Chen.

sentences.zh: 十五年，宋滅曹。

translations.literal: In the fifteenth year, Song extinguished Cao.

sentences.zh: 十六年，吳王夫差伐齊，敗之艾陵，使人召陳侯。

translations.literal: In the sixteenth year, King Fu Cha of Wu attacked Qi, defeated them at Ai Ling, and had people summon the Chen hou.

sentences.zh: 陳侯恐，如吳。

translations.literal: The Chen hou feared and went to Wu.

sentences.zh: 楚伐陳。

translations.literal: Chu attacked Chen.

sentences.zh: 二十一年，齊田常弒其君簡公。

translations.literal: In the twenty-first year, Qi's Tian Chang assassinated their lord Duke Jian.

sentences.zh: 二十三年，楚之白公勝殺令尹子西、子綦，襲惠王。

translations.literal: Twenty-third year, Chu's Bai Gong Sheng killed Ling Yin Zi Xi, Zi Qi, attacked Hui Wang.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-third year, Chu's Bai Gong Sheng killed Ling Yin Zi Xi and Zi Qi, and attacked King Hui.

sentences.zh: 葉公攻敗白公，白公自殺。

translations.literal: Duke Ye attacked and defeated Bai Gong. Bai Gong committed suicide.

sentences.zh: 二十四年，楚惠王復國，以兵北伐，殺陳湣公，遂滅陳而有之。

translations.literal: In the twenty-fourth year, King Hui of Chu recovered his state and with troops attacked north, killed Duke Min of Chen, then extinguished Chen and possessed it.

sentences.zh: 是歲，孔子卒。

translations.literal: In this year, Kong Qiu died.

sentences.zh: 杞東樓公者，夏后禹之後苗裔也。

translations.literal: Qi Dong Lou Gong was Xia Hou Yu's descendants posterity.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Dong Lou of Qi was a descendant and posterity of Xia Hou Yu.

sentences.zh: 殷時或封或絕。

translations.literal: During Yin times, they were sometimes enfeoffed and sometimes ended.

sentences.zh: 周武王克殷紂，求禹之後，得東樓公，封之於杞，以奉夏后氏祀。

translations.literal: Zhou's King Wu conquered Yin Zhou and sought Yu's descendants. He obtained Duke Dong Lou and enfeoffed him at Qi to continue the Xia Hou clan's sacrifices.

sentences.zh: 東樓公生西樓公，西樓公生題公，題公生謀娶公。

translations.literal: Duke Dong Lou gave birth to Duke Xi Lou. Duke Xi Lou gave birth to Duke Ti. Duke Ti gave birth to Duke Mou Qu.

sentences.zh: 謀娶公當周厲王時。

translations.literal: Duke Mou Qu was during King Li of Zhou's time.

sentences.zh: 謀娶公生武公。

translations.literal: Duke Mou Qu gave birth to Duke Wu.

sentences.zh: 武公立四十七年卒，子靖公立。

translations.literal: Duke Wu ascended for forty-seven years and died. His son Duke Jing ascended.

sentences.zh: 靖公二十三年卒，子共公立。

translations.literal: Duke Jing died in his twenty-third year. His son Duke Gong ascended.

sentences.zh: 共公八年卒，子德公立。

translations.literal: Duke Gong died in his eighth year. His son Duke De ascended.

sentences.zh: 德公十八年卒，弟桓公姑容立。

translations.literal: Duke De died in his eighteenth year. His younger brother Duke Huan Gu Rong ascended.

sentences.zh: 桓公十七年卒，子孝公丐立。

translations.literal: Duke Huan died in his seventeenth year. His son Duke Xiao Gai ascended.

sentences.zh: 孝公十七年卒，弟文公益姑立。

translations.literal: Duke Xiao died in his seventeenth year. His younger brother Duke Wen Yi Gu ascended.

sentences.zh: 文公十四年卒，弟平公郁立。

translations.literal: Duke Wen died in his fourteenth year. His younger brother Duke Ping Yu ascended.

sentences.zh: 平公十八年卒，子悼公成立。

translations.literal: Duke Ping died in his eighteenth year. His son Duke Dao Cheng Li ascended.

sentences.zh: 悼公十二年卒，子隱公乞立。

translations.literal: Duke Dao died in his twelfth year. His son Duke Yin Qi ascended.

sentences.zh: 七月，隱公弟遂弒隱公自立，是為釐公。

translations.literal: In the seventh month, Duke Yin's younger brother Sui assassinated Duke Yin and self-established, becoming Duke Xi.

sentences.zh: 釐公十九年卒，子湣公維立。

translations.literal: Duke Xi died in his nineteenth year. His son Duke Min Wei ascended.

sentences.zh: 湣公十五年，楚惠王滅陳。

translations.literal: In Duke Min's fifteenth year, King Hui of Chu extinguished Chen.

sentences.zh: 十六年，湣公弟閼路弒湣公代立，是為哀公。

translations.literal: In the sixteenth year, Duke Min's younger brother Yan Lu assassinated Duke Min and replaced him, becoming Duke Ai.

sentences.zh: 哀公立十年卒，湣公子敕立，是為出公。

translations.literal: Duke Ai ascended for ten years and died. Duke Min's son Chi was established, becoming Duke Chu.

sentences.zh: 出公十二年卒，子簡公春立。

translations.literal: Duke Chu died in his twelfth year. His son Duke Jian Chun ascended.

sentences.zh: 立一年，楚惠王之四十四年，滅杞。

translations.literal: He ascended for one year. In King Hui of Chu's forty-fourth year, they extinguished Qi.

sentences.zh: 杞後陳亡三十四年。

translations.literal: Qi perished thirty-four years after Chen.

sentences.zh: 杞小微，其事不足稱述。

translations.literal: Qi was small and tiny. Its affairs are insufficient to praise and narrate.

sentences.zh: 舜之後，周武王封之陳，至楚惠王滅之，有世家言。

translations.literal: Shun's descendants—Zhou's King Wu enfeoffed them at Chen, until King Hui of Chu extinguished them. There are hereditary houses that speak of this.

sentences.zh: 禹之後，周武王封之杞，楚惠王滅之，有世家言。

translations.literal: Yu's descendants—Zhou's King Wu enfeoffed them at Qi, until King Hui of Chu extinguished them. There are hereditary houses that speak of this.

sentences.zh: 契之後為殷，殷有本紀言。

translations.literal: Qi's descendants became Yin. Yin has basic annals that speak of this.

sentences.zh: 殷破，周封其後於宋，齊湣王滅之，有世家言。

translations.literal: Yin was broken. Zhou enfeoffed their descendants at Song. Duke Min of Qi extinguished them. There are hereditary houses that speak of this.

sentences.zh: 后稷之後為周，秦昭王滅之，有本紀言。

translations.literal: Hou Ji's descendants became Zhou. King Zhao of Qin extinguished them. There are basic annals that speak of this.

sentences.zh: 皋陶之後，或封英、六，楚穆王滅之，無譜。

translations.literal: Gao Yao's descendants were sometimes enfeoffed at Ying and Liu. King Mu of Chu extinguished them. There is no genealogy.

sentences.zh: 伯夷之後，至周武王復封於齊，曰太公望，陳氏滅之，有世家言。

translations.literal: Bo Yi's descendants were again enfeoffed at Qi by Zhou's King Wu, called Tai Gong Wang. The Chen clan extinguished them. There are hereditary houses that speak of this.

sentences.zh: 伯翳之後，至周平王時封為秦，項羽滅之，有本紀言。

translations.literal: Bo Yi's descendants were enfeoffed as Qin during King Ping of Zhou's time. Xiang Yu extinguished them. There are basic annals that speak of this.

sentences.zh: 垂、益、夔、龍，其後不知所封，不見也。

translations.literal: Chui, Yi, Kui, and Long—their descendants are not known where they were enfeoffed and are not seen.

sentences.zh: 右十一人者，皆唐虞之際名有功德臣也；

translations.literal: Right eleven people, all Tang Yu time famous meritorious virtue ministers;
translations.idiomatic: These eleven people on the right were all famous ministers with meritorious virtue during Tang and Yu's time;

sentences.zh: 其五人之後皆至帝王，餘乃為顯諸侯。

translations.literal: Their five people's descendants all became emperor kings, remainder became illustrious feudal lords.
translations.idiomatic: Their five people's descendants all became emperors and kings. The remainder became illustrious feudal lords.

sentences.zh: 滕、薛、騶，夏、殷、周之閒封也，小，不足齒列，弗論也。

translations.literal: Teng, Xue, and Zou were enfeoffed between Xia, Yin, and Zhou. They were small and insufficient to rank with the teeth. They are not discussed.

sentences.zh: 周武王時，侯伯尚千餘人。

translations.literal: During Zhou's King Wu's time, there were still over a thousand hou and bo.

sentences.zh: 及幽、厲之後，諸侯力攻相并。

translations.literal: And after You and Li, the feudal lords attacked each other with force and annexed one another.

sentences.zh: 江、黃、胡、沈之屬，不可勝數，故弗采著于傳（上）［云］。

translations.literal: Jiang, Huang, Hu, Shen and such, cannot exhaust count, therefore not collected recorded in transmissions (upper) [cloud].
translations.idiomatic: Jiang, Huang, Hu, Shen and such could not be exhaustively counted, so they were not collected and recorded in the transmissions [cloud].

sentences.zh: 太史公曰：舜之德可謂至矣！

translations.literal: Grand Historian said: Shun virtue can be called utmost!
translations.idiomatic: The Grand Historian said: Shun's virtue can be called the utmost!

sentences.zh: 禪位於夏，而後世血食者歷三代。

translations.literal: He yielded the throne to Xia, and his later generations' blood sacrifices spanned three dynasties.

sentences.zh: 及楚滅陳，而田常得政於齊，卒為建國，百世不絕，苗裔茲茲，有土者不乏焉。

translations.literal: And when Chu extinguished Chen, Tian Chang obtained government in Qi. He finally established a state that has not ended for a hundred generations. His descendants flourish and flourish. Those with land are not lacking.

sentences.zh: 至禹，於周則杞，微甚，不足數也。

translations.literal: As for Yu, in Zhou it was Qi. It was extremely tiny and insufficient to count.

sentences.zh: 楚惠王滅杞，其後越王句踐興。

translations.literal: King Hui of Chu extinguished Qi. His descendants' King Gou Jian of Yue rose.
